On 1/27/07, Jan Algermissen <algermissen1971@...> wrote:
>
> The problem with getting the IDs is of course that it violates GET's
> idempotency (every GET will result in a new ID). OTH, IDs are cheap
> and if we are not talking about hundreds of GETs per second to the
> factory, it is propably not that bad at all. It is after all just a
> resource changing over time.
>

Breaking the idempotency of GET is very bad ...

Why not have a 'factory' GET, that redirects to a new location every time, e.g.

-->
GET /id/new

<--
302 Found
Location: /id/abc123

-->
GET /id/new

<--
302 Found
Location: /id/abc124

... etc

Regards, Alan Dean
